bug.short_desc: Kerberos printing is not working over unix domain socket
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
From the GNOME control panel I can add printers. But it asks me for a username and password, when it ought to be using Kerberos (well, GSSAPI) to authenticate.
I gave it one anyway. But then it can't print properly. I do have samba-krb5-printing installed (and bug 1346668) fixed. I get this when I try to print:
Jun 15 21:38:09 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - Started with uid=0 Jun 15 21:38:09 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - AUTH_INFO_REQUIRED=none Jun 15 21:38:09 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - AUTH_INFO_REQUIRED is not set to negotiate Jun 15 21:38:09 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: ATTR: auth-info-required=negotiate ... Jun 15 21:38:09 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: Backend returned status 2 (authentication required) Jun 15 21:38:09 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: Job held for authentication.
I restarted the job. Now I get this:
Jun 15 21:40:46 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - Started with uid=0 Jun 15 21:40:46 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - AUTH_INFO_REQUIRED=negotiate Jun 15 21:40:46 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - AUTH_UID is not set Jun 15 21:40:46 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: ATTR: auth-info-required=negotiate
I deleted the job and printed a new one, and then it works:
Jun 15 21:41:30 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - Started with uid=0 Jun 15 21:41:30 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - AUTH_INFO_REQUIRED=negotiate Jun 15 21:41:30 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - Switching to gid=500 Jun 15 21:41:30 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - Switching to uid=500 Jun 15 21:41:30 i7.infradead.org cupsd[97040]: SMBSPOOL_KRB5 - Setting KRB5CCNAME to \'FILE:/tmp/krb5cc_500\'
.... although... Jun 15 21:41:31 i7.infradead.org audit[99364]: AVC avc: denied { open } for pid=99364 comm="smbspool" path="/tmp/krb5cc_500" dev="tmpfs" ino=379875397 scontext=system_u:system_r:cupsd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tcontext=system_u:object_r:user_tmp_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1

The issue is that Kerberos printing over the unix socket is broken in newer versions. It works with CUPS 1.6.3.
https://github.com/apple/cups/issues/4758
Why did it work for the second job I submitted?
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.

Can you tell cups to switch to the user who actually submitted the print job?
As far as I know the backend can run as the user 'lp' or as 'root'.
We run it as root and then switch to the user who submitted the printjob. This way we have have access to the kerberos credendital of that user.
The 'lp' user is not able, for security reasons, to access the krb5 credential cache of the user submitting the print job!
Looks like it is fixed with cups 2.2.0. However I found an issue in the smbspool_krb5_wrapper.
